intro: Malapoenna nigricans, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible but contain toxic compounds. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a velvety texture. Malapoenna nigricans is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in semi-arid environments.
